content.detailedDescription:
I���d like to report a weird sighting i had on 6/23/12.  i live in canonsburg pa.  my family and our neighbors were outside enjoying the warm weather it was after 10pm i believe.  in the northern sky we observed orange fireball-like objects traveling south.  they appeared about a minute apart for probably half an hour.  they were silent, non-blinking and appeared to be traveling at a high altitude.  they were not descending.  they eventually just blinked out before they reaching the horizon.  also when they appeared they sort of just blinked into view.  i would say each ball was visible for about 90 seconds.  we didn���t count them as we were seeing them but i would guess we saw at least 20 over the course of that 30 minutes.  my neighbor was able to video a few of them with his iphone.  i haven���t talked to him since but i doubt he would have deleted it.  

i guess i was wondering if anyone else witnessed this or have heard of similar sightings
content.summary: Indentical fireballs flying overhead 1 minute apart non blinking

content.detailedDescription: I was grilling out at home and observed a bright orange light and knew right away it was not a plane. the sky was overcast so it was against greyish white clouds. the object was moving east to west very slowly. after about a minute or so the light faded to nothing and i could clearly see the object against the clouds. i can only describe it as cylindrical and vertical like a probe or something. i watched it for a few minutes then it faded into the clouds. this was very exciting for i have never observed a craft before.
content.summary: Orange light dissapears revealing cylindrical probe like craft.

content.detailedDescription: While in my backyard i noticed something very large in size temporarily block out the moonlight and cast a shadow across the rooftops of the homes behind me.  the large shadow moved in a west to east direction very fast completely blacking out the moonlight on the rooftop areas as it passed.  it startled me and i scanned the sky but saw nothing that could cause the phenomenon.  i became very nervous and uneasy and went back inside the house.
content.summary: Large object moves thru and casts shadows across the rooftops

content.detailedDescription: I was looking out a window to see why my out side solar light kept going on and off.  i noticed a colorful bright light in the sky.  i got my photo binoculars and took several photos of the object as it moved around in the night sky.  i was wondering what this object might be.  i do not know what this object was but i had seen lights near a power line down the canyon from us a few months ago.  also my son in law and his father and my daughter had seen triangles over our property twice previous to this.  the triangles were observed in the early evening while the family were out side finishing up picking up our newly bailed hay from a field.  because we were seeing the unusual activity in the night sky and near the power lines i purchased binoculars that i could take photos with.  i really was not expecting to see this light in the sky that night, i expected to see possible toads or rabbits in my yard causing the solar light to come on.  i really think this light is malfunctioning and not related to the lights in the sky.  i watched the light for over a hour and finally went to bed.
content.summary: I took photos with my binoculars of a ufo in the night sky.  also at another date i have a photo of a light on a power line down the canyon from our home.

content.detailedDescription: I was with friends having a picnic @ the woodley park recreation area on 6/24/12 when at around 6 pm. i was lying on my back on my friend's picnic blanket looking at the clear sky and noticed a commercial airliner flying over head, but pretty high. i then noticed a white orb, very high overhead, bright or reflective, with a starlike quality about it- was stationary above the plane. the plane passes on and i watch as the orb moves along in a rather slow trajectory and then stops moving for nearly 5 mins. or more. it then proceeds to make a very wide arc, very high, pausing a few times, then heads back in the direction it came from.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Orb ufo flies over la

content.detailedDescription:
Was traveling west on queen blvd, stopped at the traffic signal on pacific ave. my girlfriend and i witnessed 3 unmarked black helicopters travel south to north at very low altitude and at a moderate to "awkwardly fast but slow enough not to look out of place" speed. the helicopters where very close and i have great eye sight and for the life of me couldn't make out any marking on any of them. they were very normal looking helicopters, not unlike an older military chopper (one that a kid might draw if he was a talented artist). 
i can't remember ever in my life seeing 3 choppers flying in formation, i have also never seen an unmarked black helicopter, seeing 3 of them that low to the ground was really out of place for my area.
content.summary: 3 unmarked black (otherwise normal looking) helicopters

content.detailedDescription:
To whom it may concern,

on june 24, 2012, i witnessed three red-orange glowing orbs for 30 - 45 seconds in glendale, az between 8:50pm - 9:00pm.

this event occurred at night following a family dinner gathering. i walked out front of my house to smoke a cigarette while my family was saying goodbye to other family members. i immediately noticed these lights due to their peculiar position in the sky which was not in the designated flight paths for our airports.

at the time of sighting, two of the three orbs were traveling east bound (towards my position) then had an abrupt directional change to north-west with an outward increased rapid elevation change at 30-40 degrees above horizon. i noticed that the two primary orbs moved symmetrically with each other which indicated they were connected. this was apparent as the objects started in a 90 degree vertical position then rotated to 10 degrees (counterclockwise) before the elevation increase. in fact, as the objects got closer i could see a faint outline which was connected between the orbs. 

the third orb was in a stationary elevation upon the witnessed duration (30 ��� 45 seconds) until the two primary objects were out of visible range. then the third object had an increased rapid elevation change similar to the two objects.

i have been a naval aviation structural mechanic (ams us navy) for the past 10 years and am knowledgeable on many different jet fighter models. being an ams, i am also quite familiar with the current jet propulsion technology as well as all of the internal workings of how aircraft operate. these objects did not display any chemical propulsion, such as fueled after burners, nor was there any sound emitted while they were navigating. this type of jet propulsion technology would be necessary to achieve the rapid altitude climb that these objects displayed. this leads me to believe that the objects used an alternate propulsion method that is not available to the public today.
content.summary: Three glowing red-orange orbs

content.detailedDescription: Three of us witnessed about twelve orbs flying in a triangle formation from west to east. the orbs glowed red, yellow, and orange.They didn't make any noise. at one point a plane came out of the clouds and followed for a minute then changed route. they disapeared into the clouds to the west. i thought they might be lanterns but they where too big and moved too quickly.
content.summary: Bright orbs flying in a triangle formation from west to east

content.detailedDescription: Generating a new report number for 1993 case.
content.summary: Generating a new report number for 1993 report

content.detailedDescription: It was during a thunder storm but storm was in the distance no where near event. fast moving cone shape light changing direction, seen it twice was waiting for a third time so i could get a picture but did not occur, second event was 5 seconds after first, my first thought was it looked like a light tornado in the sky, the light followed it self in a pulsating fashion as it moved very unnatural looking that is why i am posting this. sky was clear i can see the stars in the area where it happened, the lightning was far to the left miles away.
content.summary: Cone shape moving changing direction rapid motion.

content.detailedDescription:
It was approximately 10:15pm on june 24, 2012. i was walking east down the alley from my best friend's house to my house (our backyard's adjoin) and i looked up through the trees and saw a large reddish orange object--startling large. confused (and thinking it was a plane on fire or something like that) i sped up a little to get a good look at it--and when i saw how very large and how luminous it was, i ran to get out from under the trees to get a better look. i stopped and observed the object for about 20 seconds and realizing that i wasn't seeing a plane, i ran into the house and told my mother to "get out here, now!" and i ran back out to observe the object again. 

it was very large, a single light moving east in the sky. it was orange to orangish red. it was not a fireball, but it was similar in the luminous glow it cast. it was very bright. i did not see flames. it did not flicker or blink as a plane's lights do and it was about aspirin-sized, at least from our point of view. it didn't make a sound. the only thing i can compare it to is a glowing coal, only it didn't flicker like a coal does. 

my mother come out and observed the object as well, and made me go in and get my camera. i took a photo and a video, but the camera didn't pick up the object very well at all and my shaky hands blurred the photo, but i have circled it in the picture. the object can best be seen in the video during the first few seconds. i honestly didn't think it was picking up because it was so dark. 

as you can hear on the video, my mother called my best friend and told her and her husband to come look at it, but by the time they arrived, it was already disappearing into the clouds. it looked like when clouds scud across the moon, not like it faded out. 

while we were witnessing the object (during the video), my neighbors on the next street over let off a firework, but it was too low and it faded too fast to be related to the object--i also didn't hear any fireworks before i witnessed the object and i would have heard it in the house before i left, as i always have before. the object was too high in the sky, just below the clouds and then high enough to disappear into them. 

my best friend and i got in her car to see if we could find it, but the clouds were too thick and we did not see it again. she did not witness the ball of light.

i mostly felt excited and confused when i saw the object and then grateful my mother saw it so no one thinks i'm lying or flat out nuts. i don't know what it was, but i have no frame of reference for it and even attempting to describe it seems to fall short of the experience. 

i posted about it facebook and a friend of mine who lives in a nearby town said she knew someone who witnessed what sounds like the same thing on june 23rd. i cannot verify this.
content.summary: It was a ball of luminous light, very large and soundless, did not flicker. moving slowly to east. vanished in clouds.

content.detailedDescription: At approximately 1:45am last night/this morning (june 24th, i was taking my dogs outside for the last time and when i walked up onto my deck to come inside, i looked up at the sky (northerly direction) and saw what i thought was a star. as i am used to seeing odd things in the sky i always watch the sky and as soon as i focused on this star it moved. it seemed to be letting me know it saw me too. it moved downward without blinking or any sound and suddenly changed into a very bright fireball-like object. this was definately not a shooting star or anything i've ever seen before. it seemed to explode silently and begin descending very fast and before it reached the treeline it just disappeared. this sighting happened in less than 10 seconds i'd say. this makes the 6th unexplained sighting since last summer.
content.summary: Star-like object appears to turn into a bright fireball, descends and disappears

content.detailedDescription: I was at the 2012 eastern sierra trout opener at silver lake calif. near june lake. it was a little after four in the morning and i was getting set up for fishing. it was very dark and i was passing the time looking at the starts and i saw this object to the south west just above the silhouette of a mountain on the right side of mt. carson. the object was glowing red with toe nail moon white light moving clock wise around it. it was going up and down and then would go sideways left and right. my feeling was am i seeing this or what. i walked over to a fisherman on my right and i said " i know you think i' m pulling your leg, but look up there. it' s a ufo. he looked and didn't say much. he said " oh yah". anyway i went back to my to fishing spot and it drifted away behind the mountains. it was pretty far away, but i saw very clearly. this is the second time in twelve years i have seen a ufo here in the sierras
content.summary: Ufo sighting near silver lake calif.

content.detailedDescription: Out for a smoke i observed this object traveling slowly east,  when it disapeared behind my apartment i went to the east side of apartment to find that it was gone.  no further sightings of this object after it went behind the apartment.  video clip 100_5003 taken immediately after the video with the object shows the east side of apartment with no object.
content.summary: Observed ufo flashing lights

content.detailedDescription: Distant star like object, watched it steadily move across the night sky, in a straight line for approx. 20 secs. or more...
content.summary: Star like

content.detailedDescription: My spouse and i were relaxing on our back patio, when i noticed what appeared to be airplane lights south by southwest from where i live.  since the lights weren't blinking, and since it was moving about the same speed as a commercial jet at cruising speed, i asked my spouse what she thought the light was.  we debated for a moment, wondering what it could be.  coming from the opposite direction was a commercial airliner, with flashing white and blue lights.  the airliner and the object my spouse and i were watching were going in opposite directions, but a few miles apart as far as altitude goes.  while my wife and i were discussing what the object(the light) might have been, and since it wasn't blinking, it was white, not blue and red or any other colors, we determined that it was not an airplane, or commercial jet, nor an airforce jet.  as the two objects began to get nearer to each other, the non-blinking light vanished.  the light vanished in or around the area between salt lake city and dugway, utah.  the light simply vanished, poof!
content.summary: The object appeared to be the light(s) of a commercial jet.  however, there was no blinking, only one light, and it traveled in a straight line.

content.detailedDescription: We were just arrived at residence. the time was 2200hrs. we looked up to admire the clear sky. we observed a bright light moving at approximately 119 degrees. the initial impression was that it was a satellite. however, it was too bright and too low and moving too fast. we observed this for about 2-3 minutes. the light dimmed and then vanished. there was no trail observed either. a plane was seen shortly after traveling at 90 degrees to the trajectory of the observed object.
content.summary: We saw something bright and moving throught the sky. it eventually vanished.

content.detailedDescription: My girl friend and i seen this cross like object just hovering to our left we pulled the motorcycle over and watched it for like a min i just wrote it off as a heli but like 1 and half hour later we were heading home and seen the object not in the same place but a few miles away still dont know what it was
content.summary: My girl and i were rideing  my motorcycle and seen this object it was stationary   we we not sure what we seen  came back about 2 hrs latter and had moved a few miles away not sure what we seen

content.detailedDescription:
On june 12, 2012, at approx. 11:00pm, pdt, while walking from house to shop, my eyes were drawn to a very bright light moving from north to south over reno. i live about 38 miles ne of reno. it was moving away at a speed i would not expect from an aircraft. i saw it first at 90 degrees and in less than a minute it changed direction and disappeared at approximately 15 degrees to the south.

i found it unusual that the light was shining straight downward, and was visible from the rear. there were no strobe lights as it passed to the south, it jiggled, and the bright light faded to a very dim red light and then totally disappeared. still no strobe visible where it was, but there were several strobes visible on east/west aircraft to the south.

we are not customarily beneath north/south air traffic, it is further west. take-offs at the reno airport, are usually curfewed by 10:00pm, and are much lower as they land or take-off north or south, depending on the wind. i was not aware that there were bright landing lights facing anywhere but forward (south).
content.summary: High speed bright light focused downward, straight path then changed direction quickly

content.detailedDescription: I just came from from and notice i didnt have anything to eat in my house it was 10:24 when i left my house. i always look up in the sky at night since i take astronomy, so i know what stars im nearby i by the lil dipper. so i look and i saw a strange red dot mix with gold light, it went in a slanted line, i yelled to who ever was near by and said "hey do you see that'? this guy asked what and i pointed to the sky and he and i just stared and said "oh sh*t" what is that? i thought it would be a shooting star but it didnt have a tail and i know that for a fact. since it was a red dot going into a slanted direction, i could only think it was a ufo. i live over here in queens villiage by hempsted so the sky over here is clear. i was just shocked that i saw this last night
content.summary: Went to the store and saw a strange red dot  glowing in the sky

content.detailedDescription:
I was at disneyland paris, by the lake on the south shore facing north. i thought i saw one of the satellites and i started to watch it. i noticed it was a lot brighter than the stars, planets and what i remember the satellites being. 
it was a clear night, approx 9pm local time late september 2006.
the object was at about 75-80* from the horizon and had faint pink and blue hues to its white glow.
i could tell the object was really high up, higher than planes fly. 
initially the object was moving slowly and steadily to the west bit then dramatically and quickly changed direction to the north east. it contined going left to right between ne,e,se,sw,w,nw.
i observed it for about a minute before it started to dissapear, seemingly flying out of the atmosphere slightly to the nne, before vanishing from sight.
this object was quick and very large and was also at a very high altitude.
content.summary: Irratic movement pattern, left to right before getting smaller and disappearing (accending)

content.detailedDescription: I was riding my bike home last night in san francisco.  i stopped in the nearby park to have a smoke before bed, gathering my thoughts.  i walked my bike across the street to my apartment building and saw two of my neighbors coming home when i realized they were staring in the sky.  i saw multiple searchlights circulating from the ground up towards a red glowing aircraft.  it was stationary for about thirty seconds, glowing to a brighter red orange color.  i stood peacefully and content, then i decided to make random waving and winking gestures to which a flash returned my way from the craft.  it slowly hovered laterally towards the south until it diminished into the clouds.  i went into my building to the roof to see if i could spot it again.  i only saw the searchlights from the ground in different places, circulating.  after that, i went to bed happy, excited, and looking forward to my next experience.
content.summary: Saw a glowing red, hovering aircraft over san francisco. two of my neighbors coming home at the same time were staring up at it before me.

content.detailedDescription: I was on my way home from work and remembered i needed to pick up my prescription at cvs when i observed a large t-shape object that appearred to have blinking green and red lights. i thought wow, those are really bright port and starboard running lights. i soon saw the blueish white lights and the shape of the object and realized it was hovering. the light sequence was as follows: green, red, blueish white, blueish white, green and back to red. then the blueish white lights remained stationary for a few seconds before they began to twinkle. it also had what appeared to be long beacon antennas from each end of the points of the t. the large t-shaped object ascended straight up and then moved across to my right in such a straight angle that i thought how could something so large do that? there also appeared to be multiple levels that could be visibly seen due to the multiple lights spread throughout this object. when i first observed this object it appeared over buildings and homes but when it moved, it appearred to be hovering over another freeway i-635 (dallas/garland area of the freeway). i kept checking on the object as i continued onto my destination and lost sight of it. i retrieved my prescription and returned home wondering about what it was that i had seen. the next morning i told my husband about it and he believed i had seen a ufo. my husband is very level headed and advised me to let it sink in, wait a few days and check to see if anyone else had reported anything. there was another person who reported seeing something. however, our accounts on the object are different.
content.summary: I observed a large t-shape object that appearred to have blinking green and red lights. i thought wow, those are really bright port and starboard running lights but soon saw the blueish white lights and the shape of the object.

content.detailedDescription: I was sitting outside at a restaurant in highwood illinois last night. i looked up and saw three bright orange orbs moving in a line across the sky. i got up to follow them and take a picture. they disappeared. i sat back down at the table and looked up. two more came along the same path.
content.summary: I saw three bright orange orbs in a row, moving slowly across the sky. i  tried to follow them and i took a picture with my phone. then they disappeared, like they went straight up. when i went back to my seat, i looked up and two more came along.

content.detailedDescription: Primitive reaction
content.summary: Star like

content.detailedDescription: I noticed a very bright light high in the evening sky about 10:10 pm while walking with my wife in downtown petaluma, california.  we both saw a very bright white-colored light that was slowly moving to the east.  it was the brightest object in the sky and glowing.  we observed it for about two minutes when it suddenly dimmed to about half its original brightness.  one minute later, the object vanished.  it was a clear evening with no cloud cover.  i never noticed any aircraft in the sky at the time of the observation.  the object had no blinking lights like an aircraft and there was no sound.  i felt very excited thinking we were observing a ufo. i was surprised we saw it for only a few minutes, hoping it would hang around for a while.  after it vanished we kept looking up into the sky for more possible sightings but nothing more appeared.
content.summary: Bright light overhead moving slowly to the east, no noise, then dimmed, then vanished

content.detailedDescription: At approximately 1:00am on saturday night/sunday morning someone noticed a strange light flying overhead.  it appeared to be a fireball, but it did not fizzle out and was traveling slowly, similar to the pace of an airplane.  it did not leave a trail and appeared to be flickering a bit like it was on fire.  once it had traveled almost all the way across the sky, it was followed by another object that followed the pace and route as the previous light.  the two lights were exactly the same in their characteristics.  there was no noise of a plane or helicopter.  the lights were high overhead, probably at cloud height or higher--it was a clear night, it was hard to tell.  the lights were large, bigger than a plane probably, they were big enough to catch people's attention.
content.summary: Two fireball looking orbs.  one flew overhead at a steady pace and was followed a minute later by another

content.detailedDescription: June 23, 2012, belleville, mi,48111, 146 high st. while standing on a dock at a restaurant at 11:05-11:15 p.M. 30+ people witnessed a moving constellation of one green,red and yellow lights, three in a triangular formation, four in a square, and one light trailing, very slowly moving eastward over lake belleville and into cloud cover. it was lower than airplanes fly. it took up a huge portion of the night sky. i saw people recording this on a cell phone.
content.summary: a moving constellation.3 lights in triangular formation,then four lights in a square, and one trailing. lights remained in position, very slow eastward movement

content.detailedDescription:
Witnessed by 3 adults and 4 children...At night in a clear sky, we watched 3 lights (crafts) move toward us somewhat slowly.  we first saw them at about 30 degrees above the horizon and they continued to move towards us until they passed right overhead.  before they passed overhead, one of the three lights (the last one) appeared to change direction to the northwest and the light disappeard.  you could see a silvery-blue object where the light was.  this object was definately some sort of craft which moved without sound.  the remaining two lights continued on the same path from northeast to southwest when the second light disappeared (turned off) however this ship continued on the same path and you could see the same silvery-blue shape...The shape was more like a diamond than a triangle.  the remaining two craft continued on a southwest path with only the first craft still glowing orange/yellow and once they past overhead, the light from the first craft also disappeared.  the thing which struck all of us the most was how close they were to us (guessing at an altitued of under 5000 feet) and there was zero sound.  my youngest child did not sleep all night.

my oldest child first sighted the lights moving toward us.  we were talking and sitting under a gazebo when my oldest noticed the glowing orange lights.  at first it appeared as 3 planes on approach to the airport.  we quickly dismissed this as the airport is in a southeast direction to where we were...The lights were coming from the northeast and moving southwest.  we were all shocked that this could be a ufo and tried to explain what we were looking at while it was happening.  they (ufo's) continued until they were beyond our horizon.
content.summary: 3 distinct ligths in a straight line moved towards us without sound and then lights went off and could see object

content.detailedDescription: At around 4;10 am iwas sitting on my patio having coffee facing north,when a pulse of light appeared, heading due south it pulsed 4 times and was out of sight. the speed of this light was beyond anything i have ever seen,and quite frankly beyond anything i could have imagined.I think the light was about 1000 feet above the ground and there was not any sounds what so ever.It was so fast i could not turn my head fast enough to keep up with it i really would like to know if there was any other sightings
content.summary: A pulsing light in and out of my eyesight in less than 1 second
